item.title: 【Helpdesk】Photoshop Experts, Question About Coloring
item.description:
Hi!
So ages ago, iTunes album artwork used to have a certain contrast upon album covers that wasn't convention. Sometimes pink would look purple, and there was more vibrance/contrast.
Here is an example:

Original artwork: https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71D5S3PHRmL._SL1425_.jpg
iTunes artwork (with their contrast / vibrance): https://images.rapgenius.com/e191e9c0efe877f17c2d5e93860aae20.1000x750x1.jpg

When I try to do it manually myself, I can never get the precise coloring of the iTunes contrast version. How can I make it like the iTunes version? Do I change the color mode / profile and save it in a certain platform? Please help! Thank you!
item.author: jojojava
